library(kableExtra)

    Ramnog ecosystem

    The ramnog framework is an ecosystem of three R packages
    Package Description
    chef Core package that aids in creating endpoint specifications and coordinates the execution of the package
    chefStats Collection statistical methods that are used to make summarizations or inferences for each endpoint/outcome
    chefCriteria Collection of criteria that are use in AMNOG dossiers to determin when specific analyses should be executed
    ramnog Wrapper package tying ecosystem together

    Workflow

    All packages use Gitflow way of working. Please see the linked to resource for details on how to work in this style.

    Specific for the ramnog ecosystem, each package always has the following three branches:

    • dev For development purposes. dev is where completed feature branches should be pulled to and it should always be functional. Any uncompleted features should remain in a feature branch.
    • test testing environment. Once a new version or patch is ready, dev shouled be pulled into test, then test should be tested in a production environment.
    • main Latest stable release and is what users will interact with. Pulls to main should only come from test

    On this page
